title: How to Toast Shelled Walnuts

steps.headline: Pre-heat a large frying pan or skillet.
Add walnuts to the hot pan for a dry toast.
steps.description: The walnuts should be out of their shells and in halves. You can also add a bit of olive oil for a wet toast.

steps.headline: Stir frequently to ensure all walnuts are toasting evenly and to prevent burning.
Cook for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Walnuts should smell toasted and have started to brown.

steps.headline: Remove from heat and let cool.
Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (191 degrees Celsius).
Lay out walnuts on a baking sheet.
steps.description: The walnuts should be out of their shells and in halves.

steps.headline: Bake for 5 to 10 minutes.
steps.description: When the walnuts start to brown and smell toasted, they are done. Check the walnuts frequently to prevent burning.

steps.headline: Remove from oven and let cool before using in a dish.

tyn: 1 1/2 to 2 cups (360 ml to 480 ml) of shelled walnuts
text: Toast Walnuts on a Stove Pre-heat a large frying pan or skillet. Use medium-high heat for 5 minutes. Add walnuts to the hot pan for a dry toast. The walnuts should be out of their shells and in halves. You can also add a bit of olive oil for a wet toast. Stir frequently to ensure all walnuts are toasting evenly and to prevent burning.  Cook for 5 minutes. Walnuts should smell toasted and have started to brown. Remove from heat and let cool.  Toast Walnuts in an Oven Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (191 degrees Celsius).  Lay out walnuts on a baking sheet. The walnuts should be out of their shells and in halves. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes. When the walnuts start to brown and smell toasted, they are done. Check the walnuts frequently to prevent burning. Remove from oven and let cool before using in a dish.
